review_title: A great company to work for
pros: Once you have showed them you're trustworthy, hard worker and committed, they do anything to support you.
cons: No cons I can think of.

pros: Working with a charity that allows for flexibility, a fun and rewarding job working in the SEN sector, main role is mentor, which involves working around a timetable to suit the client's needs. It may involve going around London and getting involved in various activities. The client may want you to be more involved academically which may involve trips to the library. The role is very flexible depending on the needs as some days could involve an active lifestyle approach so setting up sport club trips.
cons: The role is based on hours available sometimes no work in a 3 week period.

pros:
Highly ambitious and rewarding agenda
Trust and freedom of action 
Supportive directors
Good people and management. Learning atmosphere.
cons: Not alot of opportunities to stay on.
